noun.description: In South India: an estate or territory held by a poligar. Frequently in plural (with modifying word or capital initial): a specific group of such territories or villages, considered as an administrative or political entity.

origin: Mid 18th century. From Telugu pāḷemu encampment, hamlet among hills, (hence) estate held by chieftain or feudal retainer from Marathi pāḷẽ confined valley from pāḷ edge, parapet.
